page.title: 13Housing in Pembury
page.content: Since World War 2 there has been much building of houses, both private and council. By the early 1980s there were about 2000 private houses and 500 council houses in Pembury. In recent years in the community there has been much concern about maintaining a balance between young and old, private and council, residents. Currently there is concern about the number of three bedroom houses in Pembury. The number of new developments increased considerably after 1960, but in recent years it has been felt such development should be stopped. Planning controls are enforced. Pembury has benefitted from its position on the edge of the Wealden Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. No nibbling at the edges has been allowed.
